2018-05-13T14:47:07Z: Alonso does his best lap of the day so far and closes to within 4.9s of seventh-placed Sainz but we're onto the penultimate lap.
2018-05-13T14:46:38Z: Vettel isn't going to trouble Verstappen. This race is done save for errors or attrition in the final laps.
2018-05-13T14:45:31Z: Hartley makes it past Ericsson and takes 12th place.

2018-05-13T14:39:04Z: Vettel isn't really making inroads in the only battle left inside the top five. Hamilton's lead is almost 18s now, with Bottas nearly 10s clear of Verstappen, who is carefully managing a 2.8s gap to Vettel. Ricciardo is quick but almost 20s down on the Ferrari.
2018-05-13T14:35:19Z: Perez has now closed to within DRS range of ninth-placed Leclerc with 10 laps left.
2018-05-13T14:34:15Z: Bottas is looking in decent shape as we approach the final 10 laps, so Ferrari's second stop is increasingly looking like a strategic error.
2018-05-13T14:29:48Z: Perez is going to be a real problem for Leclerc at the end of this race - the gap between them in ninth and 10th down to 2.4s with 15 laps left.
2018-05-13T14:29:36Z: Ricciardo has woken up, setting a new fastest lap of 1m19.147s, 0.5s quicker than Hamilton, but Ricciardo is way behind Vettel and destined for fifth unless tyre chaos comes to pass.
2018-05-13T14:27:36Z: Verstappen seems to be keeping up a reasonable pace despite that damage, so this won't be easy meat for Vettel.
2018-05-13T14:25:52Z: Though he couldn't hold the charging Perez back, Stroll looks like he's got the measure of Ericsson for 12th after a few laps of pressure. Then it's Hartley and a very distant Sirotkin completing the field.
2018-05-13T14:25:14Z: Leclerc's priority is now to resist Perez for ninth. Perez is 5.8s behind but on relatively new softs to Leclerc's mediums and closing in.
2018-05-13T14:24:42Z: This is getting very spread out in the midfield: Magnussen, in his brilliant sixth place, is 22.7s clear of Sainz behind, with Alonso another 8s back and now 5s clear of Leclerc.
2018-05-13T14:24:31Z: Hamilton sets a new fastest lap - into the 1m19s now and 15s clear of Bottas.
2018-05-13T14:23:19Z: Vandoorne is running slowly and looks like he's retiring.
2018-05-13T14:21:23Z: That damage will probably make Verstappen more vulnerable to attack from Vettel later on.
2018-05-13T14:19:51Z: A bit of a bizarre sort-of-spin for Sirotkin on the restart lap, he lost it on acceleration and slewed one way then the other across the straight. He pits to change tyres and rejoins even more emphatically last.
2018-05-13T14:19:26Z: The VSC period is over. Mercedes one-two now with Hamilton leading Bottas by 14.5s.
2018-05-13T14:19:06Z: Perez pitted to switch from mediums to softs during that VSC. He's rejoined behind Stroll and is quickly overtaking him again to retake 10th.
2018-05-13T14:18:25Z: A slow stop for Vettel cost him an extra place to Verstappen.
2018-05-13T14:17:32Z: Alonso pounces on Leclerc at the post-VSC restart and grabs eighth, then resists Leclerc's retaliation attempt.
2018-05-13T14:16:59Z: Ferrari must have been very, very confident Vettel's tyres weren't going to last. That's given track position to Bottas and Verstappen, and the field won't close up like under a normal safety car.Given we heard Mercedes warn Bottas that one-stopping Red Bulls were a threat, the top two teams seem uncertain about tyre longevity. But if that's the case, why hasn't Mercedes reacted like Ferrari?
